root.empty: No plan for the specified filters.
root.toggleLock:message:true:
Are you sure you want to unlock MRP {mrp}?

Unlocking will resume the plan recalculation for that MRP and might change the plan for Warehouse.
root.toggleLock:message:false:
Are you sure you want to lock MRP {mrp}?

Locking will disable any changes to that MRP and will stop plan recalculation of all lines in the MRP.
root.toggleLock:message:warning: Orders with the specified MRP were already picked up by the warehouse.

root.orders:menu:urgent:title: Urgent order
root.orders:menu:urgent:message:
Are you sure you want to mark the order {order} as urgent?

Urgent orders are planned at the beginning of the plan, ignoring the order priority.
root.orders:menu:urgent:failure: Failed to mark the order as urgent.
root.orders:menu:unurgent:message:
Are you sure you want to mark the order {order} as not urgent?

Not urgent orders are planned according to the order priority.
root.orders:menu:ignore:title: Ignoring order
root.orders:menu:ignore:message:
Are you sure you want to ignore order {order}?

Ignored orders are not taken into consideration during planning.
root.orders:menu:unignore:message:
Are you sure you want to stop ignoring order {order}?

Order will return to the planning queue.
root.orders:menu:quantity:title: Changing order quantity
root.orders:menu:quantity:help: Be default, Quantity to plan is equal to Quantity todo or Quantity remaining, if the Plan according to the remaining quantity setting is enabled. This value can be overwritten here.
root.orders:menu:lines:title: Changing pin to line
root.orders:menu:lines:urgent:help: Urgent order can be pinned to any line ignoring the Order priority.
root.orders:menu:remove:title: Removing order
root.orders:menu:remove:message: Are you sure you want to remove the order {order} from the queue of the current plan?

root.settings:title: Plan settings edit form
root.settings:forceWorkDay:help: Treat this date as a working day (plan will be generated even if there are no orders for the specified date).
root.settings:freezeHour:help: Hour after which the planned orders will be automatically frozen. Orders are frozen after the first SAP order import up to 30 minutes before the specified hour (if the import occurs), or after the first plan recalculation after the specified hour. For example, given a plan for 2018-01-12 with Freeze hour set to 23, the orders will be frozen 2018-01-11 at 22:45, if at 22:45 SAP orders will be imported or after the first manual plan change after hour 23:00.
root.settings:lateHour:help: Hour from which the manually added, urgent orders (late) can be planned.
root.settings:etoPilotHour:help: Hour from which orders with the E priority (ETO pilot) can be planned.
root.settings:schedulingRate:help: Coefficient that changes the time required to do a single PCE: OrderLaborTime / 100 / LineWorkerCount * 3600 * SchedulingRate
root.settings:requiredStatuses:help: List of all statuses that an order must have to be taken into consideration during planning.
root.settings:ignoredStatuses:help: List of statuses that an order must not have to be taken into consideration during planning.
root.settings:completedStatuses:help: List of ignored statuses that determine whether an order is completed. Order with these statuses will remain in the plan, but won't be planned on lines.
root.settings:ignoredWorkCenters:help: List of WorkCenters that the chosen order's operation must not have to be taken into consideration during planning.
root.settings:ignoreCompleted:help: Orders with Total quantity done greater or equal to Total quantity todo will not be taken into consideration during planning.
root.settings:useRemainingQuantity: Plan according to the remaining quantity
root.settings:useRemainingQuantity:help: Use the order's Remaining quantity instead of Total quantity todo. Remaining quantity is equal to Total quantity todo minus Total quantity done.
root.settings:hardComponents:help: An order will be classified as Difficult if it contains one of the following components. Quantity and man-hours don't matter.
root.settings:hardBigComponents:help: A Big order will be classified as Difficult if it contains one of the following components.
root.settings:mrpPriority:help: List of order MRPs that can be done on this line. Order matters.
root.settings:activeTime:help: Time of line availability on a given day. The value applies to all assigned MRP controllers.
root.settings:mrp:help: Select an MRP controller for which you want to define settings
root.settings:limitSmallOrders:help: During the first planning pass, the number of small orders that can be placed on a single line is limited by the number of lines that accept small orders. For example, MRP has 30 small orders and 5 lines that accept small orders. If the option is disabled, the first line will be completely filled with small orders. If the option is enabled, then each line will have 30/5=6 small orders.
root.settings:extraOrderSeconds:help: Number of seconds added to each planned order except the one stared at the beginning of the production shift.
root.settings:extraShiftSeconds:1: Time to start the I shift
root.settings:extraShiftSeconds:2: Time to start the II shift
root.settings:extraShiftSeconds:3: Time to start the III shift
root.settings:extraShiftSeconds:help: Number of seconds added to the first order at the beginning of the production shift.
root.settings:bigOrderQuantity:help: Minimum quantity todo, after which the order is classified as Big. Big orders can be Easy or Difficult.
root.settings:hardOrderManHours:help: Minimum number of man-hours, after which a Big order is classified as Difficult.
root.settings:splitOrderQuantity:help: Minimum quantity todo, after which a Big order is split into multiple parts.
root.settings:maxSplitLineCount:help: Maximum number of lines for which a Big order can be split. Zero - maximum available number of lines.
root.settings:mrpLine:help: Select a line for which you want to define settings in the context of the selected MRP controller.
root.settings:orderPriority:help: Order of production orders based on their classification: small, easy, difficult. Easy and difficult orders are also big.
root.settings:wh:groupExtraItems:help: If quantity of an order in the first/last group of a given line is lower or equal to the specified value, then that group will be merged with the next/previous group.
root.settings:wh:sortByLines: Sort orders in groups by line
root.changes:what:changedLines: {count} changed {count, plural, one{line plan} other{line plans}}
root.changes:removedOrders:MISSING_ORDER: Missing SAP order for the given day.
root.changes:removedOrders:INCOMPLETE_DONE: Incomplete order from the previous day was completed.

root.copySettings:mrps:empty: No MRPs to copy are selected.
root.copySettings:what:empty: No settings to copy are selected.
